job_title: Staff Pharmacist in Monroe, LA
pros: Love my coworkers - there are so many that care about each other and the patient’s we serve - definitely makes the chaotic work environment worth it.
cons: There are worse jobs out there, but as far as hospitals go, this one’s pharmacy is a mess. Management does not seem to care about identifying/fixing issues. Staff generally are left to solve problems on our own with little to no direction. Schedules come out the day before the old one expires. We are regularly understaffed, but are still expected to put out the same amount of work. People get “bullied out” if they cause a stir, or point out issues with management.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Lafayette, LA

review_title: Ok, but could be so much better
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: majority of medical staff truly care for their patients and are responsive
cons: Chronic short staffing and budget cuts by management without bedside experience has created a stressful and unsafe environment. Your license is on the line whenever you go to work. High acuity patients, lack of ancillary staff and management that thinks it's ok to continue to do more with less leaves one stressed from the second they walk in until the shift is over (and you've been charting for an extra hour and a half.) Maybe those HCAHPS scores would come up if pay was appropriate and we could staff the units.

review_title: Company does not valve employees and is always looking for a way to make more money even if it means denying care.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: Location to my home. Some of lower level staff friendly and team players.
cons: Parking is a nightmare even if you are PAYING to park. Incompetent managers/leaders. The CEO at OLOL and FMOL are practically non existent expect for a weekly newsletter email.  I've worked here for 8 years and have only seen FMOL CEO twice and about the same for the OLOL CEO. Promotions or hiring are on the buddy system and how well, I can brown nose. Culture of racism. The organization is politically connected that's why it is growing by leaps and bounds. The pay is low, census high, inexperienced leaders. I have seen better Medicaid plans than the health insurance offered and every couple of years there is a change in health insurance providers for a more cut rate less benefits than the last.  This is a Magnet hospital on paper, the front line nurses have little to know voice.  Did not pass their recent JCAHO assessment. Why I stay? Because they Blackball staff unofficially.

job_title: in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: The mission statement of FMOLHS is to serve those most in need and this hospital system does just that.  FMOLHS cares about the staff and recognizes the hospitals achievements.  I really enjoyed working at the System.
cons: Their medical insurance benefit is not as well as you expect for a company of this size.  Pay could be better and the pat answer is "the labor market surveys state we are within the acceptable rate of pay for our area".   Maybe so, but if you want employee retention, pay better.  Some of the supervisors need to management training.  In a work environment where communication is key, there is information not being passed or not making sure both parties understand the information.

job_title: Analyst in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: co-workers were very nice - helpful
cons: Management does not understand reality about how long it takes to process routine tasks. More worried about quantity than quality of service! People should matter!

review_title: Fast paced, high pressure work environment.
job_title: Department
pros: Never any boredom.  Great place for someone who is self-taught and likes to learn new things.
cons: Poor work/life balance in the Clinical IS department.  Very high turnover rate which in turn leaves very few knowledgeable people .  Poor mentality of training employees.  They fear if they train people they will leave to consult. However, that is far from the truth if the working environment were better.  No room for advancement, especially if you are good at your job.

job_title: Systems Administrator in Lafayette, LA
pros: Fast Paced Environment with great team members, Great place to learn new technology move up fast. They spend their money on technology never felt that they don't have the hardware/software to do my job or resolve an issue.
cons: Management does not communicate well. They spend more on technology than they do on their people thus there is high turnover when an employee can leave and make 20-30% more. Health benefits are below average. Understaffed.

job_title: Executive Vice President in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: Good work/life balance.  Advancement opportunities.  Many great people.   Relatively comfortable work environment.
cons: A catholic organizations that does many un-christian like things.   Inconsistency in the quality of leadership.  Silo activities.  Some poor leaders in very high positions.  Very poor communication.  Lack of consistent training budgets, especially for lower level staff.   Definitely not a leader in adopting improvements.  Very poor business decisions that waste valuable resources.  Many very good leaders have left the organization due to being unable to affect positive change.  Flagship hospital rated among the worst in the state by consumer reports speaks volumes about the real quality verse what the health system claims that it is.  Change of directions and priorities occur almost every other week.  Employee survey is allowed to be used as a hammer in management evaluations despite being preached that this is not allowed. No exit interviews.  The culture breeds mediocrity.  Many people advance merely by keeping their head in the sand and never affect any real change.

review_title: Great Team to work for but, still needs more staff
job_title: IS Helpdesk Analyst in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: Great management, willing to work with you. They understand people have families and emergencies that come with them.  They feed you often, contest,  have lots of giveaways and, events to bring families.
cons: I worked in the IS Support Center.  They honestly need more staff.   One of the biggest complaints I heard was from customers having to wait because techs are all busy on calls.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: Good accountability, teamwork, work ethics. Good mission statement. They do take measures to try to avoid laying off staff, though not always the right measures.
cons:
Very few holidays, poor work life balance, staff undervalued. For example:  this year, employees are being forced to use their PTO days on unpaid holidays, they have been gradually cutting employee benefits like this the last few years (ex: we lost 1 PTO day a year starting last year).  Transparency with staff not the greatest (on what's going on behind the scenes).
Very stuck in some old school mentalities- they miss opportunities to use their performers and reward them. 
Lots of people waiting to retire or doing the job of several people, so quality suffers.
Night shift at the ER - terrible attitudes of nursing staff toward other employees and patients. This is an easily solved issue for a leader committed to working those night shifts, getting out on the floor, talking to staff and patients REGULARLY and addressing the issues.

review_title: No place I'd work full time.
job_title: in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: I had friendly enough co-workers, and I was allowed to dive into projects that interns may not normally be engaged in.
cons: I arrived as a tyrannical leader was leaving, so my entire department was on egg shells.  Also, the Corporate Audit department has a very adversarial relationship with the rest of the organization.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: Great benefits and a friendly, relaxed culture.
cons:
Our PTO is good compared to many other companies, but we don't get as many holidays as I was used to.  
It's impossible to find out what pay grades jobs fall into or how they compare, so internal transfers can be awkward, disappointing, and frustrating for people who want to progress in their careers but stay with FMOLHS.

job_title: ER Technician in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: A wonderful opportunity to care for people, when they are most in need.
cons: I worked as an ER Technician in the emergency room at Our Lady Of The Lake Regional Medical Center for (2) years. Some of the nurses that I worked under where kind, caring professionals, but most where lazy, mean spirited and uncaring. I know for a fact, we lost several patients in the ER, as a result of this lack of care. I also felt constantly discriminated against because of my age (50+), and my race (African American).

job_title: FMOLHS Senior Service Division in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: It's a legal paying job
cons: License constantly in jeopardy. Always shortstaffed. Management are "too educated" to help on floor and are only worried about their "end of the year bonus" for saving the company money by cutting care costs. No type of morality displayed by administration or executives. Company is ran on greed!

review_title: Great caring, people...great place to make a career!

review_title: Disgusting facility, unsafe, no employee support or respect, extremely overworked, high turnover, and poor pay.
